constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 17 (Thursday, January 28, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mrs. McBATH:
H.R. 566.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3 of the U.S. Constitution:
Congress has the power ``to regulate Commerce with foreign
nations, and among the several states, and with the Indian
Tribes.''
[Page H252]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

title: To amend section 105(a) of the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act to authorize the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award a grant to a nonprofit entity for a national child abuse hotline.
